page.title: 06Farming
page.content: The area has a variable soil type ranging from sandy loam to silty clay loam. This very fertile region is therefore good for growing arable cash crops and sugar beet, oil seed rape, wheat, barley, vining and dried peas, dwarf green beans for processing, cabbages and potatoes. Some of the grass marshlands have recently been drained and ploughed due to their high fertility. This has led to conflict with conservationists. The grassland supports sheep, beef and dairy cattle in the grazing season (April through October). Hay and silage are also produced for winter feed. Pigs are fattened on one holding. The woodland is used for shooting and conservation.
